ad_types.title: Fixed Advertising
ad_types.subtitle: Fixed advertising that can be exposed by matching with shippers in specific areas

details.title: Regional Targeting Effect
details.subtitle1: It allows for the concentrated delivery of advertising messages to consumers in the specific area. Particularly, it can
details.subtitle2: create an effective advertising strategy by considering local characteristics or culture, leading to more effective advertising results.

details.title: Budget Efficiency
details.subtitle: When advertising is limited to a specific area, the advertising budget for that area can be efficiently allocated. In other words, by focusing the budget more intensively, you can increase the frequency of exposure or the size of the advertisement.

details.title: Response to Local Competitors
details.subtitle1: In areas where there is a lot of competition, advertising only in that specific area allows you to respond to competitors.
details.subtitle2: This can also greatly help in increasing local market competitiveness.

details.title: Measurement of Regional Effect
details.subtitle1: When advertising is conducted only in a specific area, you can analyze and improve the advertising effect by measuring the sales or awareness in that area.
details.subtitle2: This provides accurate information for media planning, which is very helpful for future advertising strategy development.

ad_types.title: National Advertising
ad_types.subtitle: Advertising that matches all shippers nationwide to maximize advertising effectiveness at a low cost

details.title: National Advertising
details.subtitle1: When advertising is exposed nationwide, a broader branding effect can be expected.
details.subtitle2: Since the advertisement is exposed to many people, it can increase brand awareness.

details.title: National Marketing Effect
details.subtitle1: Conducting advertising nationwide allows you to achieve a national marketing effect.
details.subtitle2: Since branding is not limited to a specific area, it can help make your product or service known to more consumers.

details.title: Exposure to a Broad Audience
details.subtitle1: By advertising nationwide, you can reach an audience that is active across the country, not limited to a specific region.
details.subtitle2: This is effective in increasing brand awareness, as there is no need to consider specific regional characteristics.

details.title: Low Cost
details.subtitle: Conducting advertising nationwide can be done at a lower cost than fixed advertising.

ad_types.title: Spot Advertising
ad_types.subtitle: Advertising that can be exposed in specific areas and at specific times on an hourly basis

details.title: Targeted Marketing Effect
details.subtitle1: Concentrated advertising in specific locations or time periods can achieve targeted marketing effects for those areas or times.
details.subtitle2: For example, preferred products or services can vary by region or time of day.

details.title: Efficient Advertising Cost
details.subtitle1: By advertising only in specific locations or time periods, you can allocate your advertising budget more efficiently. This allows you to achieve desired results more quickly and efficiently than advertising that targets an entire region or time period.

details.title: Exposure to a Broad Audience
details.subtitle1: When advertising is conducted nationwide, it can be exposed to an audience that is active across the country, not limited to a specific region.
details.subtitle2: This is effective in increasing brand awareness, as there is no need to consider specific regional characteristics.

details.title: Gaining a Competitive Advantage
details.subtitle1: By advertising in areas or time periods where competitors are not focused, you can gain a competitive advantage in those regions or times.
details.subtitle2: Therefore, conducting advertising only in specific locations or time periods has advantages such as targeted marketing effects and efficient advertising costs.
details.subtitle3: Additionally, you can expect a high advertising effect in those areas or times and secure a competitive advantage.

content.title: Truck Wrapping Advertisement
content.description1: A marketing method that conveys an advertising message by covering the exterior of a vehicle with a special vinyl film.
content.description2: It can promote products, brands, services, events, or other campaigns through the roads on which the vehicle operates.
content.description3: Advertising can be done on the sides and rear of the vehicle.
content.description4: It has the advantage of achieving a very high advertising effect on popular means of transportation.

content.title: High Exposure Rate
content.description1: Vehicle wrapping advertisements have a very high exposure rate as they catch the eye of vehicles on the road.
content.description2: Additionally, since vehicles pass through various areas while driving, the diversity of advertising regions is ensured.
content.description3: In particular, the advertising effect is even higher when driving in traffic jams or on major roads.

content.title: Wide Advertising Range
content.description1: Wrapping advertisements can include various advertising areas, allowing for multiple locations to display the ads.
content.description2: Additionally, since trucks typically use highways with heavy traffic, more people can see the advertisements.

content.title: Cost Saving
content.description1: Truck wrapping advertisements can spread ads at a lower cost compared to traditional advertising media.
content.description2: Additionally, since trucks operate on a fixed route daily, the advertising message can be delivered along the route without incurring additional advertising costs.

content.title: High Participation Rate
content.description1: Wrapping advertisements have high engagement due to the size of the vehicle, bright colors, and unique design.
content.description2: This makes people curious about the advertisement and helps it stay memorable.

content.title: Sustainability of Advertising Messages
content.description1: Wrapping advertisements have a high level of message durability. The advertisement film can last for a certain period, and since vehicle wrapping can be relatively easily removed,
content.description2: advertisers can easily update or change the advertisement if their strategy or campaign changes.

content.title: Enhancement of Brand Recognition
content.description1: Vehicle wrapping advertisements allow advertisers to promote their brand, product, or service with large images.
content.description2: This can increase brand awareness and recognition.

membershipWithdrawal.title: Cancel membership
membershipWithdrawal.heading: When canceling your MOAD membership, please be sure to read the precautions below.
precautionaryMeasures: 1. The existing ID will be permanently suspended, so re-registration using the previously used ID is not possible.
2. Membership information is stored for one year, after which the information is deleted in batches.
3. If any of the following cases apply, ID deletion is not possible.
a. If there is an advertisement under review.
b. If there is an advertisement in progress. (In progress refers to all advertisement states except those of inspection, termination, or rejection)
4. 1:1 inquiries and posts made will not be deleted and will be permanently preserved.
5. Please note that cancellation of membership withdrawal is absolutely impossible.
6. For further inquiries, please contact MOAD Customer Center.

policyList.title: Article 1 (Purpose)
policyList.content: Must Fintech Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as the 'Company') establishes this personal information processing policy (hereinafter referred to as 'this Policy') to protect the information (hereinafter referred to as 'Personal Information') of individuals (hereinafter referred to as 'Users' or 'Individuals') who use the services (hereinafter referred to as 'Company Services') provided by the Company, in compliance with relevant laws such as the Personal Information Protection Act and the Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection (hereinafter referred to as 'Information and Communications Network Act'), and to promptly and smoothly handle complaints related to the protection of Users' Personal Information.

policyList.title: Article 2 (Principles of Personal Information Processing)
policyList.content: In accordance with personal information-related laws and this Policy, the Company may collect Users' Personal Information, and the collected Personal Information may be provided to third parties only with the individual's consent. However, in cases where it is legally mandated by laws and regulations, the Company may provide the collected Users' Personal Information to third parties without prior consent.

policyList.title: Article 3 (Disclosure of This Policy)
policyList.content: The Company discloses this Policy through the main page of the Companyâ€™s website or a linked screen so that Users can easily check this Policy at any time. When the Company discloses this Policy in accordance with Paragraph 1, it will use font size, color, and other methods to ensure that Users can easily review this Policy.

policyList.title: Article 4 (Changes to This Policy)
policyList.content: This Policy may be amended in accordance with changes in personal information-related laws, guidelines, notifications, or changes in government or Company service policies or content.

items.title: If the Company amends this Policy in accordance with Paragraph 1, it will notify Users using one or more of the following methods.

subItems.title: By posting on the notice section of the main page of the Company's website or through a separate pop-up window.
By notifying Users via written document, fax, email, or similar methods.

items.title: The Company will provide notice of the amendment at least 7 days before the effective date of the Policy change. However, if there is a significant change in Users' rights, the notice will be provided at least 30 days in advance.

policyList.title: Article 5 (Information for Membership Registration)
policyList.content: The Company collects the following information for Users to register for membership in Company Services.

items.title: Required information: Name, Nickname, Date of Birth, ID and Password, Mobile Phone Number, Affiliated Company, Owned Vehicle

policyList.title: Article 6 (Information for Identity Verification)
policyList.content: The Company collects the following information for Users' identity verification.

items.title: Required information: Mobile Phone Number, Name, Date of Birth, Gender, Mobile Carrier, and whether the individual is a Korean national or foreigner.

policyList.title: Article 7 (Information for Consent of Legal Representative)
policyList.content: If consent from a legal representative is required, the Company collects the following information for the consent of the legal representative.

items.title: Required information: Guardian's Name, Guardian's Date of Birth, Guardian's Gender, whether the Guardian is a Korean national or foreigner, Guardian's Mobile Phone Number, Guardian's Mobile Carrier Information, and the relationship with the individual.

policyList.title: Article 8 (Information for Payment Services)
policyList.content: The Company collects the following information to provide its payment services to users.

items.title: Information collected for future services: Card number, expiration date, 6-digit date of birth (yy/mm/dd), bank name, and account number.

policyList.title: Article 9 (Information for Issuing Cash Receipts)
policyList.content: The Company collects the following information to issue cash receipts for users.

items.title: Mandatory collected information: Name of the recipient of the cash receipt, date of birth of the cash receipt recipient, address of the cash receipt recipient, mobile phone number, and cash receipt card number.

policyList.title: Article 10 (Information for Providing Company Services)
policyList.content: The Company collects the following information to provide services to users.

items.title: Mandatory collected information: Name, date of birth, time of birth, contact information, IP address, service usage records, records of inappropriate use, access logs, inquiry history, mobile device information, location information of your mobile device during service use, and advertising identifier information (ADID, IDFA).

Optional collected information: When using customer service or entering events, additional personal information that is not collected during registration may be collected for complaint handling, prize delivery, and tax reporting. In this process, information regarding the collection will be provided and separate consent will be obtained.

subItems.title: Customer Service: Email address, real name change information, etc.
Event Participation and Winning: Name, phone number, email address, delivery address, and resident registration number*.
Collection of Resident Registration Number: Separate consent will be obtained when collecting in accordance with relevant laws for the tax processing of winners.

policyList.title: Article 11 (Information for Service Usage and Fraud Verification)
policyList.content: The Company collects the following information for statistical analysis and verification of fraudulent use based on users' service usage. (Fraudulent use refers to acts such as rejoining after membership withdrawal, repeatedly canceling purchases after buying products, and illegally receiving economic benefits such as discount coupons and event benefits provided by the Company, as well as behaviors prohibited by terms and conditions, identity theft, and other illegal activities.)

items.title: Mandatory collected information: Service usage records, cookies, access location information, and device information.

policyList.title: Article 12 (Items of Personal Information Collected and Collection Methods)
policyList.content: The Company collects users' personal information by the following methods:

items.title: Users input their personal information on the Company's homepage.
Users input their personal information through services other than the homepage provided by the Company, such as applications.
Users input their information while using the Company's services, such as during customer service consultations and activities on bulletin boards.

policyList.title: Article 13 (Use of Personal Information)
policyList.content: The Company uses personal information in the following cases:

items.title: When necessary for company operations, such as delivering announcements.
To respond to user inquiries, handle complaints, and improve services for users.
To provide the Company's services.
For measures to restrict use against members who violate laws and company terms, and to prevent and sanction acts that disrupt the smooth operation of services, including fraudulent use.
For the development of new services.
For marketing purposes such as event and activity announcements.
For demographic analysis and analysis of service visits and usage records.
To form relationships between users based on personal information and interests.

policyList.title: Article 14 (Provision of Personal Information Based on Prior Consent)
policyList.content: Despite the prohibition on providing personal information to third parties, the company may provide personal information to third parties if the user has publicly disclosed it in advance or agreed to the following matters. However, even in this case, the company will provide personal information only to the minimum extent necessary within the relevant laws.

items.title: The company may provide personal information to third parties if the user has publicly disclosed it in advance or agreed to the following matters. However, even in this case, the company will provide personal information only to the minimum extent necessary within the relevant laws.

subItems.title: If users have agreed to prior disclosure or provision to third parties.
If required by law or upon request from investigative agencies and supervisory authorities in accordance with established procedures and methods under the law for investigation or inquiry purposes.
If necessary for billing purposes.
In the case of payments within the service according to Article 8.

items.title: The company will notify users and seek consent through the same procedures if there is a change in the third-party provision relationship or if the third-party provision relationship is terminated.

policyList.title: Article 15 (Retention and Use Period of Personal Information)

items.title: The company retains and uses users' personal information for the period necessary to achieve the purpose of collection and use of personal information.
Notwithstanding the previous item, the company retains records of fraudulent use of the service for up to one year from the time of membership withdrawal to prevent fraudulent registration and use.

policyList.title: Article 16 (Retention and Use Period of Personal Information According to Law)
policyList.content: The company retains and uses personal information as follows in accordance with relevant laws.

items.title: Retention Information and Period Under the Consumer Protection Act in Electronic Commerce

subItems.title: Records related to contracts or withdrawal from subscription: 5 years
Records related to payment and supply of goods: 5 years
Records related to consumer complaints or dispute resolution: 3 years
Records related to labeling & advertising: 6 months

items.title: Retention Information and Period Under the Communication Secrets Protection Act

subItems.title: APP log records: 3 months

items.title: Retention Information and Period Under the Electronic Financial Transactions Act

subItems.title: Records related to electronic financial transactions: 5 years

items.title: Protection and Use of Location Information Act

subItems.title: Records related to personal location information: 6 months

policyList.title: Article 17 (Principles of Personal Information Destruction)
policyList.content: In principle, the company will destroy personal information without delay when it is no longer needed for the purpose of processing users' personal information or when the retention and use period has elapsed.

policyList.title: Article 18 (Procedures for Destruction of Personal Information)

items.title: Information entered by users for membership registration, etc., will be transferred to a separate DB (or a separate filing cabinet in the case of paper) after the purpose of processing personal information has been achieved and will be stored for a certain period for information protection reasons in accordance with internal policies and other relevant laws (see retention and use period) before being destroyed.
The company will destroy personal information for which the reason for destruction has occurred after obtaining approval from the personal information protection officer.

policyList.title: Article 19 (Methods of Destruction of Personal Information)
policyList.content: The company will delete personal information stored in electronic file format using technical methods that prevent record reproduction, and personal information printed on paper will be destroyed through shredding or incineration.

items.title: The company will obtain explicit prior consent from users when transmitting advertising information for commercial purposes using electronic transmission media. However, prior consent is not required in any of the following cases:

subItems.title: If the company has collected direct contact information from the recipient through a transaction relationship and intends to send advertising information for commercial purposes related to the same type of goods within six months from the end date of the transaction.
If the telephone salesperson, under the Act on Door-to-Door Sales, informs the recipient of the source of personal information during the phone solicitation.

items.title: Notwithstanding the preceding paragraph, if the recipient expresses a refusal to receive or withdraws their consent, the company will not send advertising information for commercial purposes and will inform the recipient of the result of the refusal and withdrawal of consent.

If the company transmits advertising information for commercial purposes using electronic transmission media from 9 PM to 8 AM the following day, it will obtain separate prior consent from the recipient.
When transmitting advertising information for commercial purposes using electronic transmission media, the company will clearly specify the following matters in the advertising information:

subItems.title: Company name and contact information
Information on how to express refusal to receive or withdraw consent

items.title: When transmitting advertising information for commercial purposes using electronic transmission media, the company will not take any of the following actions:

subItems.title: Actions that avoid or interfere with the recipient's refusal to receive or withdrawal of consent.
Actions that automatically generate the recipient's contact information, such as telephone numbers or email addresses, by combining numbers, symbols, or letters.
Actions that automatically register telephone numbers or email addresses for the purpose of transmitting advertising information for commercial purposes.
Various actions to conceal the identity of the sender of the advertising information or the source of the advertisement.
Various actions to deceive the recipient for the purpose of transmitting advertising information for commercial purposes to induce a reply.

items.title: The company allows only users aged 14 and above to register for membership to protect the personal information of children under 14.

Notwithstanding the preceding paragraph, if the user is under 14 years old, the company will obtain consent for the collection, use, and provision of the child's personal information from the child's legal representative.

In the case of the preceding paragraph, the company will additionally collect the name, date of birth, gender, duplicate registration confirmation information (ID), mobile phone number, etc., of the legal representative.

policyList.title: Article 22 (Inquiry and Withdrawal of Consent for Personal Information Collection)

items.title: Users and legal representatives may inquire about or modify their registered personal information at any time and may request withdrawal of consent for personal information collection.

To withdraw consent for the collection of their registration information, users and legal representatives may contact the personal information protection officer or the responsible person via written communication, phone, or email, and the company will take action without delay.
Users may request correction of errors in their personal information using the methods described above.

In the case of the preceding paragraph, the company will not use or provide the personal information until the correction is completed, and if incorrect personal information has already been provided to a third party, the company will notify the third party of the correction results without delay to ensure that the correction is made.
Users must keep their personal information up to date, and they are responsible for any issues that arise from inaccurate information input.
In cases of membership registration using another person's personal information, users may lose their membership eligibility or face penalties under relevant personal information protection laws.
Users are responsible for maintaining the security of their accounts and may not transfer or lend their accounts to third parties.

The company will take necessary measures to protect users' personal information from any risks and will implement measures to minimize exposure to personal information by minimizing the amount of information retained.
In the event of a data breach or violation of users' personal information, the company will take immediate action to investigate the cause and minimize damage.

policyList.title: Article 26 (Handling of Deleted Information)
policyList.content: The company processes personal information that has been terminated or deleted at the request of the user or their legal representative in accordance with the 'Retention and Use Period of Personal Information' specified by the company and ensures that it cannot be accessed or used for any other purposes.

policyList.title: Article 27 (Encryption of Passwords)
policyList.content: Users' passwords are stored and managed using one-way encryption, and verification or changes to personal information can only be performed by the individual who knows the password.

items.title: The company strives to prevent the leakage or damage of users' personal information due to hacking, computer viruses, or intrusions into the information and communication network.
The company uses the latest antivirus programs to prevent the leakage or damage of users' personal information or data.
The company uses an intrusion prevention system to ensure the utmost security in case of emergencies.
If the company collects and retains sensitive personal information, it ensures the secure transmission of personal information over the network through encrypted communication.

policyList.title: Article 29 (Minimization of Personal Information Processing and Training)
policyList.content: The company restricts the number of personnel handling personal information to a minimum and emphasizes compliance with laws and internal policies through training and other administrative measures for personal information processors.

policyList.title: Article 30 (Measures Regarding Personal Information Leakage, etc.)
policyList.content: When the company becomes aware of the loss, theft, or leakage of personal information (hereinafter referred to as 'leakage, etc.'), it promptly notifies the affected user of all matters listed below and reports to the Korea Communications Commission or the Korea Internet & Security Agency.

items.title: Items of personal information that have leaked, etc.
Time when the leakage, etc. occurred
Measures that the user can take
Response measures taken by information and communication service providers, etc.
Department and contact information where users can receive consultations, etc.

policyList.title: Article 31 (Exceptions to Measures Regarding Personal Information Leakage, etc.)
policyList.content: Despite the above provisions, if there is a legitimate reason such as the company not being able to ascertain the user's contact information, the company may take measures to notify users by posting on its website for more than 30 days in lieu of the notification.

policyList.title: Article 32 (Protection of Personal Information Transferred Abroad)

items.title: The company does not enter into international contracts that violate personal information protection laws and related regulations regarding users' personal information.
The company obtains the user's consent to provide (including inquiries), entrust processing, or store users' personal information abroad (hereinafter referred to as 'transfer').

If all matters specified in paragraph 3 of this article are disclosed in accordance with the personal information protection law and related regulations, or are notified to the user in a method specified by Presidential Decree such as email, the consent procedure for processing, entrusting, or storing personal information may not be required.
To obtain consent under the main text of paragraph 2 of this article, the company shall notify the user in advance of all matters specified below.

subItems.title: Items of personal information to be transferred
Country to which personal information is transferred, date and method of transfer
Name of the recipient of personal information (if a corporation, the name and contact information of the person in charge of information management)
Purpose of use of the recipient's personal information and retention/use period

items.title: When the company obtains consent to transfer personal information abroad under the main text of paragraph 2, it implements protective measures in accordance with the personal information protection law and related regulations.

policyList.title: Article 33 (Designation of Personal Information Protection Officer)

items.title: The company has designated related departments and a personal information protection officer as follows to protect users' personal information and address complaints related to personal information.
Personal Information Protection Officer
items.name: Name: Cha Juheon

items.title: Data subjects may apply for dispute resolution or consultation with the Personal Information Dispute Mediation Committee, the Korea Internet & Security Agency Personal Information Infringement Reporting Center, etc., for remedies due to personal information infringement. For other personal information infringement reports or consultations, please contact the institutions listed below.

subItems.title: Personal Information Dispute Mediation Committee: (toll-free) 1833-6972 (www.kopico.go.kr)
Personal Information Infringement Reporting Center: (toll-free) 118 (privacy.kisa.or.kr)
Supreme Prosecutors' Office: (toll-free) 1301 (www.spo.go.kr)
Korean National Police Agency: (toll-free) 182 (ecrm.cyber.go.kr)

items.title: The company guarantees the data subject's right to self-determination regarding personal information and strives to provide consultation and remedy for damages due to personal information infringement. If reporting or consultation is needed, please contact the relevant department mentioned in paragraph 1.

Those who suffer infringement of rights or interests due to a disposition or omission made by the head of a public institution in response to requests under Articles 35 (Access to Personal Information), 36 (Correction or Deletion of Personal Information), and 37 (Suspension of Personal Information Processing, etc.) of the Personal Information Protection Act may file an administrative appeal in accordance with the provisions of the Administrative Appeal Act.

privacyList.title: Article 1 (Purpose)
privacyList.content: The purpose of these terms is to define the rights, obligations, and responsibilities of the "Company" (hereinafter referred to as "Company") and the "Advertiser" (defined below) in providing advertising services (defined below) offered by the "Company" to the "Advertiser".

privacyList.title: Article 2 (Definitions)
privacyList.content: The definitions of the terms used in these terms are as follows:

items.title: "Advertisement" (hereinafter referred to as "Advertisement") refers to the exposure of the "Advertiser"'s "Advertising Material" (defined below) on "Advertising Media" according to the content and procedures of the advertising products applied for by the "Advertiser" (defined below) as provided by the "Company".
"Advertising Material" refers to the product descriptions, product photos, texts, or images created by the "Advertiser" and registered with the advertising media.

"Advertising Product" refers to what the "Company" sells to the "Advertiser" for publishing the "Advertising Material" on the "Advertising Media". The specific details of the types of advertising products, exposure forms, locations, etc., are as specified in the separate descriptions provided for each advertisement and advertising product (posted on the website). Other costs related to advertising execution will be posted in the advertising contract at the time of the agreement as a principle.

"Advertising Service" refers to all services such as exposing the "Advertising Material" of the "Advertiser" on the "Advertising Media" according to the content of the advertising product purchased by the "Advertiser", including ad registration, ad management, reports, and other services.
"Advertiser" refers to a person who applies for and uses the "Service" according to the procedures defined in these terms.
"Mode Advertiser Web" refers to the service page (website URL) provided by the "Company" for the "Advertiser" to apply for, publish, manage, and cancel advertisements.

"Service Usage Fee" refers to the amount paid by the "Advertiser" to the "Company" as compensation for using the service. This amount will be specified in the advertising contract upon signing the agreement after the advertisement application.
"Advertising Media" refers to the platform or channel where the "Advertisement" is exposed.
"Sales Deposit" refers to the amount that the "Advertiser" deposits in advance for executing advertisements.
"Company" shall post the contents of these terms on "Mode (website URL)" in a way that is easily accessible for the "Advertiser".

If the "Company" revises these terms, it shall specify the application date and the reasons for the revision, and notify the current terms along with the revised terms at least seven (7) days prior to the application date. However, if the terms are changed to the detriment of the "Advertiser", it shall notify at least thirty (30) days in advance.

If the "Company" clearly notifies or communicates to the "Advertiser" that if the "Advertiser" does not express any intention within the period specified in the previous paragraph after notifying or communicating the revised terms, it will be considered as agreed, and if the "Advertiser" does not explicitly express refusal, the "Advertiser" shall be deemed to have agreed to the revised terms.

The "Advertiser" shall agree to the contents of the following "Terms" provided by the "Company", apply for use according to the procedures set by the "Company", and the contract shall be established upon acceptance of such application by the "Company."

subItems.title: Agreement to the "Basic Terms"
Agreement to these "Terms"
Confirmation of completion of "Advertiser" registration

items.title: The "Company" may restrict the use of advertising services if the "Advertiser" has any of the following reasons:

subItems.title: If false information is provided or if the content presented by the "Company" is not included
If the "Advertiser" loses eligibility due to violation of the basic terms
If the "Company" reasonably determines that it is necessary to restrict the use of advertising services

privacyList.title: Article 5 (Registration, Restriction, and Management of Advertisements)

items.title: "Company" announces the types of advertising products, advertising areas, registration procedures, billing methods, and advertising products at the "Mode Advertising Center", and the "Advertiser" should carefully check this before applying for advertisements.

"Company" will only conduct formal inspections to verify whether the "Advertisement" and "Advertising Material" applied for by the "Advertiser" meet the procedures, standards, and methods set by the "Company." The "Company" will not review the substantive validity, scope, subject of rights, or relevant contracts between the "Advertisement" and the "Advertising Material." The "Company" is not responsible for the cancellation, deletion, or temporary suspension of the "Advertisement" or "Advertising Material" based on reports or requests from claimants, and this should be resolved between the claimant and the "Advertiser." The "Company" will publish advertisements approved after inspection by the "Company" of the "Advertiser"'s "Advertising Material" on the "Advertising Media."

The "Advertiser" must deposit the sales deposit before the advertisement is published. If the "Advertiser" has not deposited sufficient sales deposit in advance, the publication of the "Advertisement" may be suspended, and the "Advertiser" will be responsible for any issues arising from this.

"Company" may restrict or suspend the publication of the "Advertisement" if the "Advertisement" and "Advertising Material" of the "Advertiser" fall under any of the following conditions, and the "Company" shall not be liable regarding the suspension of the advertisement.

subItems.title: If the "Advertiser" accesses the "Advertising Service" in a manner not provided by the "Company"
If any legal or financial risks are caused or likely to arise for the "Company"
If actions cause system load on the "Company"'s advertising media, servers, and facilities
If actions violate the advertising contract with the "Company"
Any other actions that interfere with the normal operation of the "Advertising Service"

items.title: The "Advertiser" may apply for the purchase, addition, deletion, publication, or suspension of the "Advertisement" at any time by accessing "Mode" according to the procedures and methods specified by the "Company."

privacyList.title: Article 6 (Change and Suspension of Advertising Services)

items.title: "Company" has the authority to determine the scope of advertising media where advertisements are displayed, the display area on the advertising media, display order, display information, UI, etc. (hereinafter referred to as "Advertising Area, etc."), and may change or add to them.

"Company" may conduct tests targeting certain keywords and traffic for the improvement of the quality of the "Advertising Service" and the enhancement of the effectiveness of advertisements, and will notify the contents of the tests through the "Mode" announcement section at least five days in advance before conducting them.

In the event of maintenance checks and replacements of information and communication facilities, or due to communication or system failures, the provision of services may be temporarily suspended. In case of service suspension, the "Company" will promptly notify the "Advertiser" of the suspension via the main "Mode Advertising Center", announcement board, or through email, telephone, etc. However, exceptions apply to service suspensions due to unforeseen circumstances that the "Company" cannot predict.

privacyList.title: Article 7 (Settlement of Advertising Service Usage Fees, etc.)

items.title: The "Company" will automatically deduct the advertising service fees specified in the previous clause from the sales deposit that the "advertiser" has deposited with the advertising media on a daily basis. This portion will be separately detailed in the advertising contract between the "Company" and the "advertiser" regarding service fees.
The "Company" will issue a tax invoice for the actual advertising service fees incurred by the "advertiser," and the "advertiser" can request the issuance of the tax invoice through the "Company."

The advertising service fees specified in paragraph 1 of this article may vary, and in such cases, the "Company" will display the intended changes on the initial screen of the "Mode Advertising Center" and provide notification seven (7) days in advance.

In the event that a reason for compensation or refund arises during the use of the "advertising service," the "Company" will generally compensate or refund the corresponding amount to the "advertiser." The refund amount will vary depending on the advertising period and content. Detailed information will be subject to the advertising application terms and conditions.

When the "Company" sends a notice to the "Advertiser," unless otherwise specified in the "Basic Terms," "Terms and Conditions," or "Advertising Contract," the notice can be sent to one of the email addresses, (mobile) phone numbers, or addresses provided by the "Advertiser" to the "Mode Advertising Center," or in lieu of a notice, through methods such as alert windows when the "Advertiser" logs into the "Mode Advertising Center."

The "Advertiser" must provide the "Company" with accurate and reachable email addresses, (mobile) phone numbers, and addresses, keep this information up to date, and confirm the notices from the "Company."
The "Company" is not responsible for any disadvantages arising from the "Advertiser"'s neglect of the obligations in the preceding paragraph.

privacyList.title: Article 9 (Termination, Conclusion, and Refund of the Service Agreement)

items.title: The "Advertiser" may request the termination of the advertising service agreement at any time by accessing the "Mode Advertising Center." However, in this case, the termination details will follow the termination clause outlined in the advertising contract created at the time of the advertising contract. If not explicitly stated, the "Advertiser" can terminate the advertising contract after paying a penalty of 10% of the total contracted advertising amount.

The "Company" may terminate the service agreement in the following cases. In this case, the "Company" will notify the "Advertiser" of the termination reasons through email, phone, fax, or other methods. However, the "Company" may give the "Advertiser" an opportunity to express their opinion on the termination reasons in advance.

subItems.title: The "Advertiser" loses or is suspended from their mode membership.
The "Advertiser" fails to deposit the "Sales Deposit," preventing the "Company" from executing the advertisement.
The "Advertiser" has made false applications, violated relevant laws, or breached the "Basic Terms" and these terms.
Other objectively judged circumstances that indicate the "Advertiser" cannot fulfill this contract.

items.title: Except for the contents specified in Article 9, Section 2, if the "Company" terminates the service agreement, any service application made by the "Advertiser" will be automatically canceled, and regarding the refund of the advertising amount after the termination of the advertising contract, it will follow the termination clause outlined in the advertising contract created at the time of the advertising contract. If not explicitly stated, a full refund will be given for the remaining balance from the total contracted advertising amount.
The "Company" shall comply with relevant laws and these "Terms and Conditions" and shall make every effort to continuously and stably provide the "Advertising Service."

The "Company" shall establish a security system to protect personal information (including credit information) so that the "Advertiser" can securely use the "Advertising Service" and must publicly announce and comply with the privacy policy.

If the "Company" recognizes that the opinions or complaints raised by the "Advertiser" regarding relevant laws are legitimate, it must address them and can communicate the processing process and results to the "Advertiser" via bulletin boards or emails within the "Mode Advertising Center."

To improve advertising effectiveness, the "Company" may provide the "Advertiser" with advertising setting features and will make every effort to ensure that advertisements are displayed according to the conditions set by the "Advertiser."

The "Advertiser" must comply with relevant laws such as the e-commerce law, the Telecommunications Business Act, the Act on Fair Labeling and Advertising, the Consumer Basic Act, and other policies established and published by the "Company" for customer protection and service reliability improvement, along with these terms, individual agreements, and seller operation policies.
To ensure smooth service provision by the "Company," the "Advertiser" must regularly check notices posted on the Mode Advertising Center or delivered to their email notified to the "Company."
The "Advertiser" may only use the service for advertising purposes and must not provide or leak the information provided by the service to third parties.

If a dispute arises between the "Company" and the "Advertiser," customers, or third parties due to the "Advertiser"'s fault, the "Advertiser" must indemnify the "Company" at their own cost and responsibility and must compensate for any damages caused to the "Company," customers, or third parties immediately.

The "Advertiser" must not lend or transfer the service usage rights under these terms to anyone other than themselves. However, the "Company" may grant usage rights to an agency designated by the "Advertiser" from the agencies posted on the "Mode Advertising Center" only if the "Advertiser" agrees, and the supervisory responsibility towards the "Advertising Agency" falls to the "Advertiser." When the "Advertiser" designates the "Advertising Agency," the effect of that designation will be maintained for the period announced by the "Company" on the "Mode Advertising Center" (hereinafter referred to as the "Minimum Maintenance Period"), and the "Advertiser" cannot designate another "Advertising Agency" during the "Minimum Maintenance Period." The "Minimum Maintenance Period" can be confirmed.

If the contract relationship between the "Company" and the "Advertising Agency" ends or is terminated, the "Advertiser" may choose to either perform advertising work directly or designate another advertising agency with whom the "Company" has a contract. If the "Advertiser" does not make a choice, it will automatically be changed to performing advertising work directly.

If the "Advertising Agency" designated by the "Advertiser" has not logged in and has no record of paying the "Service Usage Fee" for 365 days from the day the "Advertising Agency" was designated or the day the "Advertising Agency" executed the "Service Usage Fee," the "Company" will cancel the use of the "Mode ID" account designated by the "Advertiser" and change it to performing advertising work directly. However, if the "Advertiser" has logged in and has a record of paying the "Service Usage Fee" through the designated "Advertising Agency" within 7 days after the notice of the cancellation of the "Mode ID" account usage, it can be re-used.

"The Company" shall be exempt from liability for service provision if it is unable to provide services normally due to reasons beyond its control, such as natural disasters, DDoS attacks, external attacks on service usage, IDC failures, or line failures from telecommunications service providers.

Unless there is intent or gross negligence, "The Company" shall not be liable for any damages incurred by the "Advertiser" due to service interruptions as specified in the previous paragraph, including loss of business or special damages.

"The Company" only provides the service of offering an advertising platform to expose advertisements. Under no circumstances does "The Company" represent or act on behalf of the "Advertiser" or their agency, and it assumes no responsibility for the sale of goods or services.
"The Company" is not responsible for any disruptions in service usage due to the fault of the "Advertiser."

"The Company" is not liable for the reliability, accuracy, legality, etc., of the products advertised by the "Advertiser," and it shall not be liable for damages incurred by the "Advertiser," customers, or any third parties based on reliance on this information. However, if the "Advertiser" violates relevant laws or the advertising policies of the Company, "The Company" may refrain from posting advertisements and shall not be responsible for the posting or cessation of advertisements.

privacyList.title: Article 13 (Obligations for Personal Information Protection and Confidentiality)

items.title: Each party shall endeavor to protect the "Advertiser"'s personal information in accordance with relevant laws such as the "Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection." The protection and use of the "Advertiser"'s personal information shall be governed by the policies of "The Company."

Each party must not disclose the personal information, technical information, management information, etc., received from the other party under paragraph 1, which is managed as confidential, to third parties unless required by law, and shall not use that information for any purposes other than fulfilling the contract.

privacyList.title: Article 14 (Dispute Resolution)
privacyList.content: These terms and conditions shall be governed and executed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of Korea, and any disputes arising in connection with the use of this service shall be subject to the jurisdiction of the court that has jurisdiction over the address specified in the Civil Procedure Act.

items.title: "The Company" does not guarantee where and how frequently the "advertising materials" for "external platform advertising" will be posted on the "external platform advertising" network, nor the method by which priority is determined among different "Advertisers."
"The Company" may change the technology for "external platform advertising" or suspend the posting of "advertising materials" without notifying or compensating the "Advertiser."

"The Company" will measure the necessary metrics to calculate clicks and/or the advertising fees that the "Advertiser" will incur through servers of external platform advertising companies selected by "The Company" and will provide the measurement results to the "Advertiser."

"External platform advertising" carries the risk that a third party may perform acts that mislead or inappropriately affect the number of clicks or other fees under this contract. "The Company" assumes no liability to the "Advertiser" for such fraudulent clicks or any other inappropriate acts that may occur.

"The Advertiser" must diligently review the measurement results provided by "The Company" regarding the implementation of "external platform advertising" and decide whether to continue the "external platform advertising." The "Advertiser" may not contest the measurement results specified in (3) against "The Company."

privacyList.title: Article 16 (Effective Date)
privacyList.content: These terms and conditions are effective from October 1, 2024.

privacy.section01InfoText: MOAD Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as â€œCompanyâ€) considers the personal information of users who use the Internet site (homepage URL, hereinafter referred to as â€œMOADâ€) operated by the company to be very important and has the following personal information processing policy. This personal information processing policy will be updated if there are changes in laws or guidelines related to personal information, and may vary depending on changes in the policy, so users are advised to check it frequently when visiting the MOAD Marketing Platform site. MOAD Marketing Platform's privacy policy contains the following contents.

policyItem01.title: Article 1. Collection and Use of Personal Information

items.text: The purpose of the company collecting personal information is to confirm the user's identity and intention to use the service in order to provide optimized and customized services. The company collects only the minimum necessary information required to perform the essential functions of the service at the initial membership registration, and may additionally collect information necessary for payment processing, goods delivery, refunds, etc., depending on the services provided.
The company will not use personal information for purposes other than the collection and use purposes without the user's consent or provide it to a third party without the user's consent.

The company may collect and use personal information for the following purposes. However, in addition to the information obtained with consent under relevant laws such as the National Tax Basic Act and the Electronic Financial Transactions Act, the company may inform users and collect such information if it is unavoidable for collection and storage purposes.

tableContent.title: 1) Members

items.purpose: Confirmation of member identity, handling of complaints and inquiries, provision of information on new products/services and notifications, communication related to advertising execution, etc.
items.items: ID (email address), password, name, phone number, affiliated company
items.retentionPeriod: 6 months after user withdrawal / 1 month after rejection, but in case of transactions, according to relevant laws regarding retention period

tableContent.secondItem: During the service use process or business processing process, the following information may be automatically generated and collected, stored, combined, and analyzed. Usage history information such as IP address, visit date and time, service use records, etc.: Prevention of illegal use, prevention of unauthorized use, development of new services and provision of customized services, etc.

policyItem02.title: Article 2. Provision of Personal Information to Third Parties

items.text: The company uses the personal information of users within the scope notified in the 'Collection and Use of Personal Information' and does not exceed this scope without prior consent of the user or generally provide the user's personal information to third parties. However, there are exceptions as follows:
When users have previously agreed to disclosure or provision to third parties

When there is a requirement based on legal regulations or at the request of investigation authorities and supervisory agencies according to the procedures and methods prescribed by law for investigation or investigation purposes
When necessary for fee settlement

Users may provide personal information to third parties. You may not consent, and may consent to provision to a third party at any time. You can withdraw. Even if you refuse to consent You can use the membership registration service, but it is not provided by a third party. The use/provision of related services may be restricted. Any changes to the provision of other personal information to third parties will be notified and A separate notice will be provided.

policyItem03.title: Article 3. Outsourcing of Personal Information Processing

items.text: The company may outsource the processing of personal information to third parties in order to provide smooth and improved services. In this case, the company shall inform users of all the following matters in advance and obtain their consent. The same applies even if any of the following matters change.
The entity receiving the outsourcing of personal information processing.
The details of the tasks for which personal information processing is outsourced.

The company may outsource the processing of personal information to third parties in order to provide smooth and improved services. In this case, the company shall inform users of all the following matters in advance and obtain their consent. The same applies even if any of the following matters change.

When entrusting work related to the processing of personal information, the company takes necessary measures to ensure that personal information is safely managed at the time of consignment contract in accordance with relevant laws and regulations. When entering into a consignment contract, the company considers the trustee's ability to protect personal information and periodically checks whether the trustee fulfills his or her duties, including safe management and destruction of personal information. Additionally, the information we entrust to process is limited to the minimum information necessary to provide smooth service.

policyItem04.title: Article 4. Retention of User Personal Information: Period of Use and Disposal

items.text: The company generally notifies, agrees, retains, and uses the user's personal information for the period agreed upon and specified by the user, and promptly destroys it when the purpose of collecting and using the personal information is achieved or when the user requests its destruction. However, the following information is retained for the specified reasons.

Reasons for retaining information under relevant laws and company policies: If it is necessary to retain the user's personal information in accordance with the provisions of relevant laws, the company will retain the user's personal information in accordance with the provisions of the law and will not use it for purposes such as marketing.

Retention Period: The retention and use period of collected personal information is from the time of service use agreement (membership registration) to service use agreement termination (withdrawal application, forced withdrawal included). Also, when consent is withdrawn, the company promptly destroys information other than data stored for a certain period according to the reasons for information retention specified above. If personal information processing is outsourced to a third party, the company instructs the contractor to destroy it as well.

policyItem05.title: Article 5. Use and Management of Cookies

items.text:
Purpose of using cookies:
1) The company uses 'cookies' to store usage information to provide personalized services on websites operated by the company. Cookies are small amounts of information that a website server sends to a user's browser and are stored on the user's computer's hard drive.
2) The company can provide specific personalized services possible only through the use of cookies.
3) The company may use cookies to identify members and maintain their login status.

Installation/Operation and Refusal of Cookies:
1) Users have the option to choose whether to install cookies. Therefore, users can allow/reject all cookies or require confirmation each time a cookie is stored by adjusting options in their web browser:
  - Select [Internet Options] from the [Tools] menu.
  - Click the [Privacy] tab.
  - Set the [Privacy Level].

policyItem06.title: Article 6. Access, Correction, and Withdrawal of Personal Information

items.text: Users can request to access, correct, or delete their personal information through the Personal Information Customer Center at any time. If requested via email or in writing, we will process access, correction, or deletion accordingly. If a user's personal information has been provided to or entrusted to a third party, the user can request deletion from the company or the third party/trustee. However, it is not possible to correct the member ID (ID) and name, except in exceptional cases such as name changes due to marriage or changes in business registration numbers due to administrative issues. If correction or deletion is prohibited or restricted by other laws, the processing may be limited. Furthermore, if a request for correction of personal information errors is made, we will not use or provide the personal information until the correction is completed, unless requested to provide the personal information under another law. If incorrect personal information has already been provided to a third party, we will notify the third party of the correction results to ensure correction.

Users can request the suspension of processing of their personal information on the MOAD Marketing Platform site at any time. However, a request for suspension of processing may be rejected in the following cases:
1) When it is unavoidable to comply with special provisions of the law or fulfill legal obligations.
2) When there is a risk of harming another person's life or body, or unfairly infringing on another person's property and other interests.
3) When it is difficult to fulfill the contract, such as providing services agreed upon with the information subject, unless the information subject clearly expresses their intention to terminate the contract.

Users can withdraw their consent to the collection, use, and provision of personal information agreed upon through membership registration at any time. We will promptly take necessary measures such as deleting personal information upon request for withdrawal of consent by clicking on 'Apply for Membership Withdrawal' on the company's website, or by contacting us in writing or via email. However, if the company is required by law or the terms and conditions to retain the user's personal information, the processing will proceed. In this case, users must provide their member ID and identification information for identity verification, and there may be some restrictions on services or inability to use certain services due to withdrawal.

policyItem07.title: Article 7. User Responsibilities and Legal Compliance

items: a. Users are responsible for protecting their own personal information, and the company is not responsible for problems arising from the leakage of personal information due to issues on the Internet beyond the company's control, such as transfer, lending, loss of ID, password, access medium, hacking using methods or technologies that cannot be blocked by the user's carelessness or security measures under relevant laws, despite the company's considerable care.
b. Users must keep their personal information up to date, and they are responsible for problems arising from incorrect information input by the user.
c. Membership registration using another person's personal information or payment processing using stolen IDs may result in loss of user eligibility and punishment under relevant laws.

d. Users are responsible for maintaining the security of their IDs, passwords, etc., and cannot transfer or lend them to third parties. Users must cooperate with the periodic change of passwords for security purposes according to the company's privacy policy.
e. After using the company's service, users must always log out of their accounts and close the web browser program.

f. Users must comply with the 'Act on Promotion of Information and Communication Network Utilization and Information Protection,' 'Personal Information Protection Act,' and other laws related to personal information.
The company may provide links to other websites to users. However, this 'Privacy Policy' does not apply to websites that are linked and collect personal information.

policyItem09.title: Article 9. Security Measures for Personal Information Protection

items: The company implements the following technical/administrative measures to ensure the safety of personal information and prevent its loss, theft, leakage, alteration, or damage.

encryption.title: a. Encryption of Personal Information
encryption.description: User passwords are stored and managed using one-way encryption, and personal information confirmation and modification are only possible by the user who knows the password. Passwords are generated and applied according to password creation rules to prevent easy guessing of numbers such as the user's birthday or phone number. Personal information such as passwords is stored and managed using secure encryption algorithms.

hacking.title: b. Measures against Hacking
hacking.description: The company operates intrusion detection and prevention systems 24 hours a day to prevent the leakage of user personal information due to hacking or intrusion into the company's information and communication network. All intrusion detection and prevention systems are operated with redundancy to prepare for emergencies, and sensitive personal information is transmitted securely over the network through encrypted communication.

minimization.title: c. Minimization and Education of Personal Information Handlers
minimization.description: The company limits the number of personal information handlers to a minimum and raises awareness of the importance of personal information protection through educational measures and administrative actions.

dedicatedDepartment.title: d. Operation of Dedicated Personal Information Protection Department
dedicatedDepartment.description: The company operates a dedicated personal information protection department to efficiently protect personal information and promptly correct any issues found with the implementation of the privacy policy and the compliance of personal information handlers.

items: The company strives to ensure that users can safely use the company's services. Users can report all privacy-related complaints regarding the use of the company's services to the dedicated department, and the company will promptly and sincerely respond to the user's reported issues.

privacyOfficer.title: Privacy Officer
privacyOfficer.name: Lee Jinhee
privacyOfficer.note: â€» The contact information above is connected to the 'Privacy Protection Customer Center.'

agencies.name: Advanced Crime Investigation Center, Supreme Prosecutors' Office
Cyber Safety Bureau, National Police Agency

items: This privacy policy may be subject to additions, deletions, or modifications due to changes in relevant laws and guidelines or the company's needs. In such cases, notice will be given at least 7 days in advance through the website or email. If prior notice is difficult, notice will be given promptly, and the revised policy will take effect after a minimum of 7 days unless otherwise stated. However, in cases of significant changes, notice will be given at least 30 days in advance, and the revised policy will take effect after a minimum of 30 days unless otherwise stated. Additionally, the company may obtain separate consent from customers as required by relevant laws.

ad_details_data.main_line: By appropriately selecting the advertising type according to the advertising purpose, we can increase the efficiency of the advertisement.

details.sub_heading: Fixed advertising that can be displayed by matching with shippers in specific areas

list.title: Regional Targeting Effect
list.description1: It allows for the concentrated delivery of advertising messages to consumers in the specific area. Particularly, it can
list.description2: create an effective advertising strategy by considering local characteristics or culture, leading to more effective advertising results.

list.title: Budget Efficiency
list.description: When advertising is limited to a specific area, the advertising budget for that area can be efficiently allocated. In other words, by focusing the budget more intensively, you can increase the frequency of exposure or the size of the advertisement.

list.title: Response to Local Competitors
list.description1: In areas where there is a lot of competition, advertising only in that specific area allows you to respond to competitors.
list.description2: This can also greatly help in increasing local market competitiveness.

list.title: Measurement of Regional Effect
list.description1: When advertising is conducted only in a specific area, you can analyze and improve the advertising effect by measuring the sales or awareness in that area.
list.description2: This provides accurate information for media planning, which is very helpful for future advertising strategy development.

ad_details_data.main_line: By appropriately selecting the advertising type according to the advertising purpose, we can increase the efficiency of the advertisement.

details.sub_heading: Advertising that matches all shippers nationwide to maximize advertising effectiveness at a low cost

list.title: Popular Branding Effects
list.description1: When advertising is exposed nationwide, a broader branding effect can be expected.
list.description2: Since the advertisement is exposed to many people, it can increase brand awareness.

list.title: National Marketing Effect
list.description1: Conducting advertising nationwide allows you to achieve a national marketing effect.
list.description2: Since branding is not limited to a specific area, it can help make your product or service known to more consumers.

list.title: Exposure to a Broad Audience
list.description1: By advertising nationwide, you can reach an audience that is active across the country, not limited to a specific region.
list.description2: This is effective in increasing brand awareness, as there is no need to consider specific regional characteristics.

list.title: Low Cost
list.description: Conducting advertising nationwide can be done at a lower cost than fixed advertising.

ad_details_data.main_line: By appropriately selecting the advertising type according to the advertising purpose, we can increase the efficiency of the advertisement.

details.sub_heading: Advertising that can be exposed in specific areas and at specific times on an hourly basis

list.title: Targeted Marketing Effect
list.description1: Concentrated advertising in specific locations or time periods can achieve targeted marketing effects for those areas or times.
list.description2: For example, preferred products or services can vary by region or time of day.

list.title: Efficient Advertising Cost
list.description: By advertising only in specific locations or time periods, you can allocate your advertising budget more efficiently. This allows you to achieve desired results more quickly and efficiently than advertising that targets an entire region or time period.

list.title: Exposure to a Broad Audience
list.description1: When advertising is conducted nationwide, it can be exposed to an audience that is active across the country, not limited to a specific region.
list.description2: This is effective in increasing brand awareness, as there is no need to consider specific regional characteristics.

list.title: Gaining a Competitive Advantage
list.description1: By advertising in areas or time periods where competitors are not focused, you can gain a competitive advantage in those regions or times.
list.description2: Therefore, conducting advertising only in specific locations or time periods has advantages such as targeted marketing effects and efficient advertising costs.
list.description3: Additionally, you can expect a high advertising effect in those areas or times and secure a competitive advantage.

content.third: MOAD will do its best to ensure the safe operation of cargo carriers and the proper use of services. The following are the items to check before using the service. You may choose not to agree to these terms, but please note that refusal to agree will render the service unavailable. After applying for advertisement, Mode will contact you via the phone number and email you provided to prepare the advertisement contract. Before applying for an advertisement, please confirm once again that the information provided is correct.
content.fourth: Users (hereinafter referred to as 'Users') using this service acknowledge and agree that they are solely responsible for all consequences arising from attaching advertisements to cargo vehicles and operating them through this service (such as vehicle accidents, personnel, and operation failure due to vehicle breakdown). Furthermore, it is the responsibility of the cargo owner to comply with safety regulations and ensure smooth traffic flow during operation. Additionally, advertisers must cooperate properly to fulfill these obligations.
content.fifth: Please contact the MOAD customer center if there are any issues during operation or if any special circumstances arise. Thank you.
